meanings.definition: To assess or determine the value of something again.
meanings.sent1: I need to revaluate the price of my old bike before selling it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to revaluate the property value annually.
meanings.sent3: After realizing I paid too much, I had to revaluate the worth of the antique vase.
meanings.sent4: She decided to revaluate her friendship after the betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The team will revaluate their strategy to win the game.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or reevaluate a decision or opinion.
meanings.sent1: Before making a final choice, I always revaluate my options.
meanings.sent2: It's wise to revaluate your goals regularly to stay on track.
meanings.sent3: I had to revaluate my dislike for broccoli after trying it in a new recipe.
meanings.sent4: She had to revaluate her stance on the issue after hearing new arguments.
meanings.sent5: The company will revaluate their decision based on customer feedback.
